page.title: 09Home Life
page.content: Families are mainly composed of a married couple and two or three children. In large farmhouses, often three generations live together. Many teenagers, having their own radios, televisions and computers, spend a lot of home time in their bedrooms. Sometimes he only communal time for the family is the evening meal. Both men and women go out to work. Women do most of the housework, with the help of many appliances. Gas, electric, coal or gas cylinders are used for cooking and heating. Homemade food is preferred to convience meals. Local dishes like roast beef and Yorkshire pudding are favourite, but vegetarianism is becoming popular. Dogs, annual licence 37 pence, are pets, guard dogs or sheep dogs.
